Sentencas: Carbon deposition can be observed on the surface of Ni catalyst surface because of its high catalytic activity of hydrocarbon cracking, and thus cause the degradation of cell performance.
Titulo: Enhance coking tolerance of high-performance direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst

Sentencas: In this work, anode supported single cells without and with the additional internal reforming catalyst NiFe2O4-GDC are successful assembled, and then used to characterize electrochemical performance and carbon tolerance in H-2 and 50%CO2-50%CH4 fuels.
Titulo: Enhance coking tolerance of high-performance direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst

Sentencas: Both single cells without and with NiFe2O4-GDC demonstrate similarly high electrochemical performance and low electrode polarization resistance fueled in H-2, and the peak power densities are 1037.15 and 1163.36 mW/ cm(2) at 800 degrees C, respectively, the difference of which derived from the ohmic impedance and the electrode polarization resistance.
Titulo: Enhance coking tolerance of high-performance direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst

Sentencas: Interestingly, to better understand the contribution of different electrode polarization impedances, the distribution of relaxation time (DRT) analysis is used to distinguish different rate-limiting steps with high resolution.
Titulo: Enhance coking tolerance of high-performance direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst

Sentencas: While 50%CO2-50%CH4 fuel is applied, single cells with internal reforming catalyst NiFe2O4-GDC demonstrates high electrochemical performance (1046.72 mW/cm(2) at 800 degrees C), long-term stability and excellent carbon tolerance from the Raman scanning analysis.
Titulo: Enhance coking tolerance of high-performance direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst

Sentencas: All preliminary experimental results suggest that high performance and coking tolerance can be obtained for direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst.
Titulo: Enhance coking tolerance of high-performance direct carbon dioxide-methane solid oxide fuel cells with an additional internal reforming catalyst
